subject: Re: [junit] Re: Mock and collections.
msgSnippet: Me too looking forward to reading it. I met a problem of mocking collection. (Maybe not similar, but I didn t read through the code LuiZ gave:) My problem is
messageBody:
Me too looking forward to reading it. I met a problem of mocking collection.
(Maybe not similar, but I didn't read through the code LuiZ gave:)
My problem is that
===== Code starts =======================
public override void MethodToBeTested(IInterpretable interpretable,
XmlElement e)
{
......
foreach (IInterpretable item in interpretable.GetItems())
{
DoSomethingOn(item);
}
}
=====Code ends =====
Each time I want to test the method (MethodToBeTested) with NMock, I have to
mock serveral children items and add them to the list.
=====Code starts (test method)=====
......
IList<IInterpretable> items = new List<IInterpretable>();
items.Add(t0);
items.Add(v);
items.Add(t1);
......
Expect.AtLeastOnce.On(str).Method("GetItems
").WithNoArguments().Will(Return.Value(items));
===== Code ends =====
Creating items is tediously, is there a better solution?

2006/11/21, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@...>:
>
> Luiz Siqueira wrote:
> >
> >
> > Ok, I found a easy solution for my problem, Even the code becomes more
> clear
> > with this new approach. Soon I will send to you the new code. I will
> make a
> > article about this too.
>
> I look forward to reading it! The explanations will help me understand.
>
> > Thanks. :)
>
> You're welcome. I'm glad I could help.

eagle in the sky
